intro: Androsace villosa f. glabrata, commonly known as the glabrous mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in early spring, which attract pollinators such as bees. Its foliage is often covered in a fine layer of pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and moist environments, thriving in high-altitude habitats.
